meanings.definition: To cause to go or be taken to a destination.
meanings.sent1: She is sending a letter to her friend.
meanings.sent2: I will be sending the package tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The cat keeps sending the toy mouse under the couch.
meanings.sent4: His words were like sending a wave of comfort over her.
meanings.sent5: The sun sending its warm rays through the window felt comforting.

meanings.definition: The action of causing something to go or be taken to a destination.
meanings.sent1: The sending of the invitation was delayed.
meanings.sent2: We received the sending of the documents yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The sending of the balloons made the party more festive.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a sending of joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The sending of the birds migrating south signaled the change of season.
